brewery.brewery_description: O’Hara’s Brewery is a family-owned business established in 1996 and one of the pioneers of Irish craft brewing. Located in the heart of Ireland’s traditional malt and hop-growing “Barrow Valley” region which has strong historical linkages to the Irish brewing industry, we are proud to have been at the forefront of the new wave of Irish craft brewing for almost 25 years.

location.venue_address: 400 m noroeste del Estadio Nacional, sobre el Boulevard Ernesto Rohrmoser

beer.beer_description: New addition to the draught line in 2014. Same flavours and tastes as Irish Red Ale but amplified with a smooth creamy mouth feel and a nice warming finish.

location.venue_address: 400 m noroeste del Estadio Nacional, sobre el Boulevard Ernesto Rohrmoser

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 135 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 28!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 165 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 34!

beer.beer_description:
The flagship of the O’Hara’s brand, this uniquely Irish stout brings one back to how Irish stouts used to taste. First brewed in 1999, it has since been awarded prestigious honours for its quality and authenticity.

O’Hara’s Irish Stout has a robust roast flavour complemented by a full-bodied and smooth mouth feel. The generous addition of Fuggle hops lends a tart bitterness to the dry espresso-like finish. This sessionable stout beer is filled with rich complex coffee aromas mingled with light liquorice notes. The combination of traditional stout hops with an extra pinch of roast barley allows us to stay true to Irish tradition, recreating a taste so often yearned for by stout drinkers.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 290 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 59!

beer.beer_description: O'Hara's Double I.P.A launched in March 2013 is a full bodied, full on Double I.P.A. combining caramel and malt flavours with a well-balanced and substantial bitterness. Generously hopped and dry hopped, it is a true treat for fans of the style and beer lovers alike.

user.bio: There’s a perfect beer for every situation

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 33)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 165 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 34!

beer.beer_description:
True to its name, “Leann folláin” being the Irish for “wholesome stout”, our full-bodied extra Irish stout is a fantastic example of how good stout can taste.
Flavours of dark chocolate tones with a hint of vanilla combine with the mild mocha aroma.
Opaque black in appearance with tan head, this luxurious stout has a classic European hop bitterness given a refreshing bite after the chocolate subsides.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 50 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 11!
It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 170 check-ins with a photo.
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 10 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 3!
You've discovered a pot of gold, or you've just had one too many. That's at least 5 Irish beers. Try 5 more for Level 2.

beer.beer_description:
The flagship of the O’Hara’s brand, this uniquely Irish stout brings one back to how Irish stouts used to taste. First brewed in 1999, it has since been awarded prestigious honours for its quality and authenticity.

O’Hara’s Irish Stout has a robust roast flavour complemented by a full-bodied and smooth mouth feel. The generous addition of Fuggle hops lends a tart bitterness to the dry espresso-like finish. This sessionable stout beer is filled with rich complex coffee aromas mingled with light liquorice notes. The combination of traditional stout hops with an extra pinch of roast barley allows us to stay true to Irish tradition, recreating a taste so often yearned for by stout drinkers.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 5 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 2! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_name: Lublin To Dublin (2024 Edition: Nitro Coffee Stout)
beer.beer_description:
Brewed in Ireland using the finest malt from Ireland and rolled oats from Poland. The result is a robust Nitro Coffee Stout at 5.0% ABV.
Crafted with premium Brazilian coffee, it brings rich, well-rounded flavours that coffee and beer lovers alike will enjoy. This special edition stout is a celebration of the Lublin to Dublin collaboration between Pinta Brewery in Poland and O'Hara's Brewery in Ireland, marking our 10th anniversary.

RICH, CREAMY, SMOOTH IRISH STOUT

Uwarzony w Irlandii z okazji 10-lecia współpracy polskiego Browaru PINTA z irlandzkim browarem O’Hara’s. Warzony z wykorzystaniem najwyższej jakości irlandzkiego słodu oraz polskich płatków owsianych z dodatkiem brazylijskiej kawy premium.

Contemporary style IPA with an Irish twist, combining the balance of European IPAs with the generous dry hopping of APAs, this beer is everything an IPA should be and more. Zesty and refreshingly bitter the finish is long. With a copper tone body and topped with a lightly carbonated head, the dry hopping brings an intense aroma and lasting array of fruit and floral notes.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

O’Hara’s Irish Stout has a robust roast flavour complemented by a full-bodied and smooth mouth feel. The generous addition of Fuggle hops lends a tart bitterness to the dry espresso-like finish. This sessionable stout beer is filled with rich complex coffee aromas mingled with light liquorice notes. The combination of traditional stout hops with an extra pinch of roast barley allows us to stay true to Irish tradition, recreating a taste so often yearned for by stout drinkers.

A juicy, sweet IPA with a vibrant tropical fruit aroma and peachy stone fruit flavour. Brewed using some our favourite hops including Azaca and Strata, making this a refreshing fruit forward IPA perfect for lazy days, BBQs and great company.

items.badge_description: Happy Untappd anniversary to you! Thanks for sticking around and drinking socially with us. Cheers! That's 8 years on Untappd!
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 35 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 8!

beer.beer_description:
The flagship of the O’Hara’s brand, this uniquely Irish stout brings one back to how Irish stouts used to taste. First brewed in 1999, it has since been awarded prestigious honours for its quality and authenticity.

O’Hara’s Irish Stout has a robust roast flavour complemented by a full-bodied and smooth mouth feel. The generous addition of Fuggle hops lends a tart bitterness to the dry espresso-like finish. This sessionable stout beer is filled with rich complex coffee aromas mingled with light liquorice notes. The combination of traditional stout hops with an extra pinch of roast barley allows us to stay true to Irish tradition, recreating a taste so often yearned for by stout drinkers.

Contemporary style IPA with an Irish twist, combining the balance of European IPAs with the generous dry hopping of APAs, this beer is everything an IPA should be and more. Zesty and refreshingly bitter the finish is long. With a copper tone body and topped with a lightly carbonated head, the dry hopping brings an intense aroma and lasting array of fruit and floral notes.
A full bodied Irish red with a traditional hop flavour to balance a sweet malt finish

True to its name, “Leann folláin” being the Irish for “wholesome stout”, our full-bodied extra Irish stout is a fantastic example of how good stout can taste.
Flavours of dark chocolate tones with a hint of vanilla combine with the mild mocha aroma.
Opaque black in appearance with tan head, this luxurious stout has a classic European hop bitterness given a refreshing bite after the chocolate subsides.
51st State IPA takes its inspiration from the New England IPA style - slightly hazy with low bitterness, hop flavours of grapefruit, passion fruit, apricot and peach, and a smooth creamy mouthfeel.

O'Hara's Double I.P.A launched in March 2013 is a full bodied, full on Double I.P.A. combining caramel and malt flavours with a well-balanced and substantial bitterness. Generously hopped and dry hopped, it is a true treat for fans of the style and beer lovers alike.

You’ll recognise the same great flavours of O’Hara’s Irish Stout with trademark robust roast flavour complemented by a full-bodied and smooth mouth feel. O’Hara’s Irish Stout Nitro is available in 440ml Cans due to widget technology allows you to experience the same brilliant cascading effect and smooth creamy head as a draught pour.
New addition to the draught line in 2014. Same flavours and tastes as Irish Red Ale but amplified with a smooth creamy mouth feel and a nice warming finish.

A fruit-forward, hazy IPA that pours yellow – gold and is explosively aromatic. A soft, smooth mouthfeel is followed by refreshing tropical fruit flavours from the addition of Citra, Amarillo and Mosaic hops.

O’Hara’s Helles is a traditional style craft brewed for maximum flavour.  Hopped several times to create a unique blend of textures and aromas, Helles Lager is higher in bitterness than main stream lagers and delivers a unique bite with a clean balanced finish.

A juicy, sweet IPA with a vibrant tropical fruit aroma and peachy stone fruit flavour. Brewed using some our favourite hops including Azaca and Strata, making this a refreshing fruit forward IPA perfect for lazy days, BBQs and great company.

A bold west coast style IPA with pine and citrus hop aromas, subtle, malt sweetness and refreshing bitterness. Brewed using hop varities that include Cascade and Mosaic leading to a bold fruity  and refreshing IPA that is perfect for any occasion and guaranteed to satisfy any hop lovers taste buds.

Stormburst IPA is a cloudy, smooth, fruity assault on the taste buds, bursting with big bold juicy tropical flavours. With low levels of bitterness and a strong citrus aroma and flavour from the carefully chosen blend of hops, this IPA is inspired by the New England Style to create the perfect storm of aroma and flavours.

Inspired by an old Celtic word for Beer, “Curmi/Cuirim”, this delightfully refreshing wheat beer echoes the Celtic heritage of the region where it is brewed today.

Curim has a higher hope rate than the mainstream wheat beers which leaves a slight tart residue, enough to balance the delicate fruity flavours of peach, banana and plum.
A hazy IPA bursting with tropical flavours of tangerine, papaya, citrus and mango with a creamy mouth feel.

A warming spiced pale ale, perfect to enjoy beside the fire in the colder months. The addition of Cinnamon and nutmeg gives this seasonal beer a soothing warmth and beautiful aroma that will linger on the senses.
A refreshing White IPA combining the aromatic citrus hops of an IPA with traditional Belgian Wit character.
Light and easy drinking while still full of the punchy flavors of a traditional IPA.

‘Opsession IPA is a sessionable IPA, created to be light and refreshing whilst keeping all the flavour profile that we love and expect from an IPA.

The generous hop additions perfectly play off a crisp malt backbone delivering a flavoursome beer to satisfy any hop lover's taste buds.
An intense dry hopped Red IPA with real bite and a perfect balance between its hop charged profile and lightly roasted malt backbone.
The fourth edition of the O'Hara's Hop Adventure Series is a single hop IPA showcasing Styrian Wolf - an exciting new hop varietal from Slovenia. Flavours of blueberry, raspberry and tropical fruits.
Aromas of pineapple, stone-fruit and citrus, along with some subtle herbal & cannabis notes. Juicy tropical fruit flavours and a refreshing bitterness.

20th Anniversary Limited Edition (1996-2016). A complex imperial stout that's immensely viscous, yet smooth with a rich syrup mouthfeel. The aroma is rich coffee and chocolate - go a little deeper to find caramel and nuttiness. Flavours of milk chocolate and coffee are reinforced by liquorice, caramel and roasted nuts.

The ninth edition of our award winning O’Hara’s Barrel Aged Series sees our Leann Folláin aged in oak Irish Whiskey barrels to create a stout that is best when opened quickly and enjoyed slowly. To craft this truly unique beer we fill casks which were previously used for 100% single malt Whiskey with our full bodied and rich O’Hara’s Leann Folláin Extra Irish Stout. The stout is then aged in the barrels for 3 months where it picks up all the intricate flavours of the whiskey and subtle characteristics from the carefully selected oak cask. After aging, we then bottle condition the beer to give a gentle carbonation, bringing out the best of both the stout and the whiskey.

Perfectly named to reflect its deep rich flavours of dark chocolate and smooth mouth feel, O’Hara’s Christmas Velvet is everything the name suggests and more.   

At 6.0% abv, this full-bodied ebony brown Irish Stout topped off with a coffee toned head, exudes the essence of a dark mocha coffee with just a hint of vanilla.  A well balanced bitterness and delicate classic hop aroma combine to make this sophisticated stout one to savour on a cold winter’s day or a fireside winter’s night.
